definition: Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat
to receive/to accept/to suffer/subjected to/to bear/to stand/pleasant/(passive marker)

sentences.english: The result is that many have jeopardized their performance in the long run.
sentences.chinese: 結果就使得他們在長遠經營中蒙受一定的損失。

sentences.english: Such an act of cowardice by an officer shames his whole regiment.
sentences.chinese: 一個軍官作出如此膽怯的行爲使整個團都蒙受羞辱。

sentences.english: Leave work area without taking safe measure, cause company significant loss.
sentences.chinese: 擅離職守，致公司蒙受重大損失者。

sentences.english: And Russia is making up for past humiliations after the collapse of the USSR.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯在洗刷前蘇聯瓦解之後所蒙受的屈辱。

sentences.english: Whoever ignorantly creates an attachment, that stupid person comes upon suffering again and again.
sentences.chinese: 無知的蠢人執着生存因素，一再蒙受痛苦。

sentences.english: Farmers and poultry producers have lost billions of dollars as a result.
sentences.chinese: 農牧民和家禽飼養商因此蒙受了數十億美元的損失。

sentences.english: Grace is like a paradise in blessings, and mercy remaineth for ever.
sentences.chinese: 仁愛有如蒙受祝福的花園，慈善永遠常存。

sentences.english: Their actions have wiped off billions of dollars in their companies' market capitalisations.
sentences.chinese: 他們的行爲也使公司蒙受了數以億計的損失。

sentences.english: Would you bring infamy on your sacred profession?
sentences.chinese: 你願意給你神聖的職業蒙受恥辱嗎？

sentences.english: Our whole educational system suffers from this evil.
sentences.chinese: 我們整個教育制度都蒙受其害。

sentences.english: The insurance company will compensate you for your pecuniary loss in the snow disaster.
sentences.chinese: 保險公司會賠償你在雪災中所蒙受的經濟損失。

sentences.english: The new government removed the injustice under which the population had labored.
sentences.chinese: 新政府洗雪了人民過去所蒙受的冤屈。

sentences.english: Her criminal record branded her for life.
sentences.chinese: 她的犯罪記錄使她終生蒙受恥辱。

sentences.english: Our disgraced teacher was publicly rehabilitated by school authorities.
sentences.chinese: 學校當局爲我們的蒙受恥辱的老師公開恢復了名譽。

sentences.english: If ye offer in sacrifice a peace offering to the Lord, that he may be favourable.
sentences.chinese: 若你們給上主祭獻和平祭，要奉獻可蒙受悅納的。

sentences.english: They redressed the grievances done to the chief engineer years ago.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲好幾年前總工程師所蒙受的冤屈平反昭雪。

definition: to be thoroughly discredited/to fall into disrepute
to avoid suffering/to avoid meeting (a fatal accident)/spared
to be saved from/to be spared (something)
to recruit (followers)/to scout for (talent etc)/to incur/to lead to
to weigh down/to trouble/to implicate (sb)/tied down (by affairs)
to offend sb/to give offense/to displease
